A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. Use extra sheets of paper if there is not sufficient space to answer the questions. Don't hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires which have been prepared or projected are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Workforce. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
SASKATOON, Saskatchewan.

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

3. Date: APRIL 4, 1963
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country) NEW BRUNSWICK
5. What was your father's name and occupation? EDWARD GRAHAM
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year) DECEMBER 1902

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.)
9. What were your reasons for coming West?
   After having worked at Brandon, Manitoba & fell greatly in love
   Fall at Brandon, Manitoba & fell greatly in love
   With the work and farming particularly
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?)

Weekly by reading about it and later farming out to pasture. This wonderful crop of grain

33. When did you come to Saskatchewan the first time? With what idea of staying permanently?
Did any people move away from your district prior to 1914? What reasons did they have for moving?

They moved away because their family wanted to live in a place where they could earn a living. They moved away because they had no money and needed a change.

Did many people move away during the 1930s? Did many return?

Yes, many people moved away during the 1930s. Some returned after the Great Depression ended.

If you or anyone in your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.

My father was the chairman of the local school board for several years. He also served as a trustee for the local hospital.

If you or any of your family or friends were "firsts" to have or do something in the district, combine organizing the first lodge, etc.

My brother was the first to own an automobile in our town.

How did the places in your community get their names?

School districts, post offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc., were named by the families who lived there.

What was the name of the school in your town?

The school was called Williston School.

What was the name of the post office in your town?

The post office was called Williston Post Office.

What was the name of the creek in your town?

The creek was called Willow Creek.

Did any of these places change their names? If so, when and why?

Williston School changed its name to Williston Center School in 2000 due to a population increase.

Did any of these places change their names? If so, when and why?

Williston Post Office changed its name to Willow Creek Post Office in 2005 due to a population decrease.
